entry.title: Deadly Baghdad Violence Condemned by Iraqi Cleric Moqtada al-Sadr
entry.content: The prominent Shia Muslim cleric, whose withdrawal from public life triggered deadly clashes, condemned his supporters for attacking security forces and called on them to leave the city’s Green Zone.

entry.title: Ukraine Aims to Build on Initial Gains in Southern Offensive
entry.content: Ukrainian forces pressed forward with an offensive in the country’s south, seeking to build on gains after launching the assault to retake the Kherson region a day earlier.

entry.title: How Two Mexican Drug Cartels Came to Dominate America's Fentanyl Supply
entry.content: The Sinaloa and Jalisco organizations have taken over from Chinese sellers as a dominant source of the potent synthetic opioid, a leading cause of the U.S.’s record overdoses. Among the reasons, it is easier and less expensive to produce than heroin.

entry.title: China Sets October Date for Party Congress Where Xi Can Extend Power
entry.content: The announcement by China’s Communist Party kicks off final preparations for the twice-in-a-decade party conclave where Xi Jinping is expected to extend his stint as paramount leader and maneuver allies into key positions.
